fastily.jwiki.core

Enum ColorLog

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<ColorLog>
      • fastily.jwiki.core.ColorLog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<ColorLog>

    public enum ColorLog
extends Enum<ColorLog>
    Colors a String and logs it to console. Your terminal must support ASCII escapes for this to work, otherwise the text will not be colored.
    Author:
    Fastily

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      BLACK
      A font color, black, which can be applied to a String if your terminal supports it.
      BLUE
      A font color, blue, which can be applied to a String if your terminal supports it.
      CYAN
      A font color, cyan, which can be applied to a String if your terminal supports it.
      GREEN
      A font color, green, which can be applied to a String if your terminal supports it.
      PURPLE
      A font color, purple, which can be applied to a String if your terminal supports it.
      RED
      A font color, red, which can be applied to a String if your terminal supports it.
      WHITE
      A font color, white, which can be applied to a String if your terminal supports it.
      YELLOW
      A font color, yellow, which can be applied to a String if your terminal supports it.

        public static ColorLog valueOf(String name)

        Parameters:

      • makeString

        public static String makeString(String text,
                                ColorLog c)
        Formats a String for ASCII colored escape output if the system you're using supports it. Returns non-escaped ASCII text otherwise.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to color
        c - The color to use
        Returns:
        The colored string, or the same string if this system does not support ASCII color escapes.

      • log

        public static void log(String s,
                       String l,
                       ColorLog c)
        Logs a message to the standard error output stream
        Parameters:
        s - The message
        l - The identifier to log the message at (e.g. "INFO", "WARNING")
        c - The color to print the message with. Output will only be colored if this terminal supports it.

      • warn

        public static void warn(String s)
        Output warning message. Text is yellow.
        Parameters:
        s - The String to print.

      • info

        public static void info(String s)
        Output info message. Text is green.
        Parameters:
        s - The String to print.

      • error

        public static void error(String s)
        Output error message. Text is red.
        Parameters:
        s - The String to print.

      • debug

        public static void debug(String s)
        Output debug message. Text is purple.
        Parameters:
        s - The String to print.

      • fyi

        public static void fyi(String s)
        Output miscellaneous message. Text is blue.
        Parameters:
        s - The String to print.
